snippet: Medical experts say Nelson Mandela, the stricken South African icon, is probably being sustained by equipment, which could present his relatives, doctors and the country with a painful choice.
abstract: Medical experts say stricken South African icon Nelson Mandela is likely being sustained by equipment, which could present his relatives, doctors and the country with a painful choice about how long to keep the 94-year-old alive; South African laws and court precedents leave some unnerving gray areas over who might make ultimate decision.

byline.contributor: Sheelagh McNeill contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Medical experts say Nelson Mandela, the stricken South African icon, is probably being sustained by equipment, which could present his relatives, doctors and the country with a painful choice.

headline.main: Mandela’s Kin Face Gray Area on End of Life
headline.print_headline: Mandela’s Kin Face Gray Area On End of Life

keywords.value: Living Wills and Health Care Proxies
keywords.name: subject
